result.execSummary:
The defendant Raequon D Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raequon D Allen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raequon D Allen was found guilty of Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-prev provided per DCSO.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

prelim hrng to deft.
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant.  Motions due in 20 days.  Bail continued.
Copy given defendant, reading waived.
Trial Judge - Br 15

Defendant Raequon D Allen in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides. Prosecuting Atty Robert J. Jambois appeared for State of Wisconsin. ADA Jambois states he originally had 2 witnesses for this hearing today, but will only actually have one witness testifying, and he stated the reasons why. FBPD Det. Sean Coffey sworn & testified. Direct exam by ADA Jambois. Exh #1 - Certified copy of JOC in case #14CF22 - Upon no objection, Court will take judicial notice of this document. Exh #2 - Copy of Criminal complaint in this matter. Upon no objection, court ordered exhibit #2 is received in its entirety and specifically counts 1, 2, 3, 6 & 7. Cross exam by Atty Benavides. Witness excused. State moves for bindover & made arguments. Response arguments by Atty Benavides. Rebuttal arguments by ADA Jambois. Court finds probable cause the defendant committed a felony and ordered him boundover for further proceedings.
